COMMENT_TX: $Lenhardt reached into stands to rob DiMaggio of homer
$described in paper as attempted double steal with error on return throw, but no one credited with SB or CS
$Ball off Johnson's shin, runner only got to third
$soft fly for double when fielders collided
$Fox singled, but thought Sievers had caught the ball, so he turned to the dugout and was thrown out
$Garver missed third as he was scoring on doubple, called out on appeal
$No error indicated in any source, but we need a runner and this is a good way to find one
Batts misses Evers foul pop, no error charged
Dobson comes in with 2-0 count on Keller, finishes walk
Ball lodged under rolled up tarp and Evers sent back to third
Pictures look like it should have been E1 for a wild throw
Rogovin enters with 1-0 count on Zernial
Rogovin developed sore arm and had to leave game
Infield single and Guerra does not score
Don't know when Wertz error was, but did not put a man on
Don't know when Burtschy's WP was
$Newspaper accounts say PB that was really a wild pitch. Apparently, official scorer changed it later, but as WP run is earned, contrary to official data as unearned
$Calvert came in with a 1-1 count after the PB (should have been a WP)
$AL rule did not allow turning on lights to finish a day game. $Very dark now due to rain clouds, so players had trouble seeing ball.
$Game called due to darkness and rain after 31 minute wait
Lenhardt made an error, which did not put a man on. No idea when or if it was a dropped foul.
Priddy dropped throw for force out
Leaping catch in left-center robs Zernial of a homer
37 minute rain delay at this point
Lights turned under rule that permitted it only on team's last trip to city First time in AL history lights were turned on in after start of day game
Wyse comes in with 1-0 count on Lipon
Swift pulls tendon in right thigh, leaves game
Leaping catch takes away an extra base hit, turns into DP
Lenhardt hit on elbow has to leave the game
Ginsberg's error did not put a man on, but don't know for sure this was it
Double steal not in any story, so it is deduced
Ball went through RF Wood's legs to RF fence
Light rain started falling and lasted into the 7th
Error could have been on another batter in the inning
$Do not know there was an error on the play or if it was by DeMars $Could have been by Friend $2 Browns errors put men on, 2 did not
$Need an error to put a man on, most likely in this inning $Could have been by DeMars
$Don't know for certain error was here, but is quite likely $Error could have been by Friend
Trout objects to call on 2-2 pitch and argues vociferously, but is not ejected
$Kolloway's error put a man on, but don't know when and what type
Lipon gets deep spikes by Friend on slide and leaves game
$Do not know when and details of Friend's error, but did not put a man on
Moses called for interference, but throw to first beat Suder
Joost's error may have been on a different play
Tebbetts ejected arguing call at first base
Newhouser out for running out of baseline to avoid tag. Pesky threw to first in time to get Lipon, so did not matter
This K not shown in official records for Lollar and Trout. Described in two inning play-by-play in Detroit Times
$Official records charge all runs in inning to Fannin, but Widmar allowed Priddy's run
Hard hit ball to SS took a bad hop
$Ricker pulled muscle on Lollar's triple
Mapes and Coleman collide letting DeMars foul pop fall untouched
Lopat comes in with 2-0 count on Demars; walk charged to Porterfield
Friend's error did not put a man on; don't know when or type
Ball booted towards stands caroms by RF Wood
Don't know type of or when Demars error was, but it put a man on Quite likely it was in this inning, but could have been any of the first three hitters
Runner going on 3-2 pitch, slow bounder to short 1B Lenhardt argued call forgetting about Berra, who scored
Do not know when Marshall's WP was
Wood threw wildly to first after making running catch of blooper

$LF Kokos traps line drive, throws to plate in time to force Stephens $HP ump Summers said C Lollars foot not on plate, so no force out $St. Louis manager Taylor ejected by Summers for arguing the play
Don't know when Upton made an error that put a man on
$Need an out on base, which is almost certainly a pick-off, but $no information about whom and when
Upton  pulls tendon in left leg and leaves game at end of inning
SH by #4 hitter who already has a homer and double in the game!
$Joost dropped line drive and then started DP; White Sox argued batter should be out and no DP
Don't know when and type of Berr'a error, but it put a man on
Need another out on bases, but don't know if this was it
Sox CF Scala left the game after batting in 5th by bottom of 6th No paper describes IPHR, so guessing Scala was hurt on it.
$error on relay throw
Throw hits McCoskey in the back
No info on when how Moses came in, so may have been earlier in the field
Lenhardt's throw to third was late
$Kokos caught off first after strikeout, but was safe when Fain dropped throw, also allowing Upton to score
Don't know when Zernial got assist throwing out a runner
Might have been a CS
McCosky made two bad plays in the field and was pulled as punishment
Parnell's throw hits Valo, retrieved by Doerr who throws to Dropo to retire Valo who turned toward second
Don't know when Suder's error was, but it likely put a man on
Don't know circumstances of Chapman's error, which is not in some boxes
CS may have been with a different batter up; was 26 based on Pos
Hooper pulls a muscle in his side; leaves with 2-0 count
Sievers does not slide, jams instep on left foot and leaves game
Pitcher Garver bats sixth; has .289 BA

Stirnwiess tagged and went to second, but Coleman stayed there Brissie pitched 8 innings and had 5 Ks in official records and papers' boxes Official records show only 4 for Browns batters and we don't know the other one
Wood homers on first pitch thrown by Scheib
$Tipton shaken up on play at 2nd, left for runner
$Wahl fielded the grounder and missed tagging Stephens; Athletics argued Stephens was out of baseline
$DiMaggio thought the ball had dropped and passed Parnell for the double play
ej,tebbb101,P,papaj901,Fight after HBP $Boston's Tebbetts, not in game, ejected by HP umpire Paparella for fighting as he ran onto field to attack pitcher Wyse after Dropo was hit in head
ej,taylz101,M,stevj901,Obstruction call $Stirnweiss dropped ball at 2nd and obstructed Batts from reaching base; Browns manager Taylor ejected by 1B umpire for arguing the obstruction
catcher missed throw home, allowing batter to second
$Tremendous play by Fain near third base line
$Sometime in 7th, catcher Masi fell into A's dugout trying to catch a foul ball and he spiked Guerra who had to leave game
$throw to second was wild and then throw to 1st was wild
$missed out at second but still got batter
Carrasquel strained his knee and left game
